mai
Class MaiGui

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  mai.MaiGui
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class MaiGui
extends javax.swing.JPanel

MaiGui is the main class for MAI; it manages all the GUI attributes and manages how the annotation/adjudication information is loaded, interacted with, and displayed.

All files loaded into MAI must be UTF-8 encoded, otherwise the character offsets cannot be gauranteed to work.

Version:
0.7 April 16, 2012
Author:
Amber Stubbs
See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private  class MaiGui.AboutListener
          Listens for the request from the Help Menu
private  class MaiGui.AnnCaretListener
          Keeps track of what extents in the text are highlighted by the user in order to refresh the tag tables, and assigns highlights based on the tag and extent selected.
private  class MaiGui.DisplayListener
          Listens for the command to increase/decrease the size of the font
private  class MaiGui.getFile
          Handles the actions in the File menu; loading DTDs, starting new adjudication tasks, adding files/gold standards to the adjudication task.
private  class MaiGui.jboxListener
          A quick and dirty way to change global variables based on what's going on in the link creation window so that a new link can be created more easily.
private  class MaiGui.JTableListener
          Listens to the table to determine when a tag is double-clicked, and calls the function to highlight the related extents.
private  class MaiGui.linkListener
          This is the class that's associated with the make link button in the popup window created in showLinkWindow()
private  class MaiGui.MakeTagListener
          This is the class that's called when an extent tag is selected from the popup menu
private  class MaiGui.ModKeyListener
          Keeps track of whether the CTRL key (or the equivalent Mac key) is being pressed in order to determine if the link creation window should be displayed.
private  class MaiGui.PopupListener
          Listens for mouse events in the text area; if the mouse situation meets popup requirements, give the option to create a new tag.
private  class MaiGui.RadioButtonListener
          This is the class that's called whenever a radio button is pressed.
private  class MaiGui.removeSelectedTableRows
          If the user decides to remove the highlighted table rows, this method is called.
private  class MaiGui.TableListener
          Listens to the table to determine if a button has been clicked
private  class MaiGui.TextHighlightPainter
          Creates a highlighter object that can be added to the text display

assignTextColors

private void assignTextColors(java.lang.String tagname)
Updates the colors in the text area when a new tag is chosen from the radio buttons When a tag is selected, the colors are based on which/how many files include it in the annotation (if it's in the Gold Standard, the text is green, if it's in all the files but the Gold Standard the text is blue, and if it's some but not all the files the text is red).

Parameters:
tagname - The name of the selected tag

colorVisitedLocs

private void colorVisitedLocs(java.lang.String tagname)
Goes over the text when a link is selected and colors the locations that the adjudicator has already examined.

Parameters:
tagname - that tag that's been selected

assignTextColor

private void assignTextColor(java.lang.String tagname,
                             int beginColor,
                             int endColor)
This method is for coloring/underlining text in the text window. It detects overlaps, and should be called every time a tag is added or removed.

Parameters:
tagname - the selected tagname
beginColor - the beginning of the text span being assigned a color
endColor - the end of the text span being assigned a color

                                boolean b)
Used to set the text in a span to a determined color

Parameters:
color - the color being assigned
s - the start of the span
e - the end of the span
b - whether or not the text will be underlined

fillInLinkTable

private void fillInLinkTable(mai.HashCollection<java.lang.String,java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> idHash,
                             java.lang.String tagname)
Link tables are more complicated to fill in because they require that the links from the files being adjudicated contain the IDs and text of the overlapping tags from the goldStandard

Parameters:
idHash - the hashtable containing IDs
tagname - the name of the tag whose information is being filled in

fillInTable

private void fillInTable(mai.HashCollection<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> idHash,
                         java.lang.String tagname)
Fills in the table when an extent tag is selected from the RadioButtons and a new span is highlighted in the text area.

Parameters:
idHash - a HashCollection containing relevent IDs
tagname - the type of the tag information being filled in

checkForAddition

private void checkForAddition(int col,
                              int buttonRow)
If a new file is being added to the gold standard, this method checks to make sure all the necessary information is there.

Parameters:
col - the column where the "add" button was pressed (will be 0 if this is being called from somewhere outside the tag display table)
buttonRow - the row being checked for inclusion to the gold standard

addRowToGoldStandard

private void addRowToGoldStandard(int col,
                                  int buttonRow,
                                  mai.Elem e)
Adds a new row to the gold standard, or resubmits an existing row if attributes have been changed.

Parameters:
col - the column of the button that triggered this method being called (0 if the table was not used)
buttonRow - the row being added/modified
e - the type of tag being added

private java.lang.String[] makeRow(int col,
                                   int row)
Creates a new row for the Gold Standard, usually from a button click from the table.

Parameters:
col - the column where the clicked button exists
row - the row being copied to the Gold Standard
Returns:
an array of the correct size with the some of the information filled in
